    <title>screencast_tutorials:advanced_search</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/screencast_tutorials/advanced_search?rev=1236797150&do=diff</link>         <description></description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/screencast_tutorials/annotation?rev=1343593156&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2012-07-29T16:19:16-04:00</dc:date>         <title>screencast_tutorials:annotation</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/screencast_tutorials/annotation?rev=1343593156&do=diff</link>         <description>Zotero's annotation and highlighting functionality is no longer supported.  Third-party tools can be used to annotate and highlight web pages before saving them to Zotero.  For PDFs, PDF annotation tools that save annotations directly to files will allow those changes to sync properly when using Zotero file syncing.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/screencast_tutorials/getting_stuff_into_zotero?rev=1394672355&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2014-03-12T20:59:15-04:00</dc:date>         <title>screencast_tutorials:getting_stuff_into_zotero</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/screencast_tutorials/getting_stuff_into_zotero?rev=1394672355&do=diff</link>         <description>There are tons of ways to get, books, articles, web pages, and any other kind of item into Zotero. So many, in fact, that we thought we needed this to make this short screencast. You might just be surprised at how many ways there are to get information into Zotero. This screencast covers six ways to get things into Zotero.</description>     </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.zotero.org/support/screencast_tutorials/intro?rev=1236802050&do=diff">         <dc:format>text/html</dc:format>         <dc:date>2009-03-11T16:07:30-04:00</dc:date>         <title>screencast_tutorials:intro</title>         <link>http://www.zotero.org/support/screencast_tutorials/intro?rev=1236802050&do=diff</link>         <description>Special thanks to Steve Bailey from CU-Boulder for preparing this demo. You can view Steve's other screencasts on his website.</description>     </item>     <item
